text: Palaeobalistum goedeli is an extinct species of prehistoric ray-finned fish that lived during the Cretaceous period. Fossils of this species have been found in Lebanon in the sediments of the Cenomanian Age (99.6 - 93.5 million years ago).Neal Robbins Paleobalistum goedeli ==Description== Palaeobalistum goedeli can reach a length of about and a height of about . Body is laterally compressed with an almost circular outline and a large snout. Teeth are columnar and thick, indicating a durophagous existence, breaking shells and crustaceans.Fossilmall ==References== Category:Prehistoric ray-finned fish Category:Pycnodontiformes Category:Cretaceous bony fish
title: Palaeobalistum goedeli
